issue.title: [CF 394] Settings panel no longer appears
issue.body:
Submitted Via

Curse Client 4.0.1.170, Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7600.0

Installed Version

r357

Description

After 'unlocking' with /tmw none of the TMW button 'bars' respond to right-clicks to open the per-bar settings. I have various position-locked and unlocked bars and they are all unresponsive to the right-click.

Installed Addons

Ace3 - r1045 Altoholic - Altoholic 4.3.001 Auctioneer - Auctioneer Suite 5.12.5198 Bartender4 - 4.4.20-2-g04cabae Bartender4_Dualspec - v1.2.3 BlizzMove - v1.2.4 Button Forge - Button Forge v0.9.16 Deadly Boss Mods - 4.10.6 Decursive - 2.7.0.4 Destruction For Dummies - Beta 2.1.2.3 EavesDrop - v2.46 Eclipse Bar Plus - 0.8.5 Gatherer - 3.2.4 Glance - Glance_v4.0.6.9 LibStub - 1.0.2-40200 LightHeaded - r341 MiniHugeHUD - r54 Omen Threat Meter - v3.1.5 OneBag3 - v3.4.2 OneBank3 - v3.3.14 OPie - Indigo 4 OPie_PetSkills - 1.11.12.05.14 Overachiever - achievement tools and tweaks - r93 Postal - v3.4.13-nolib Prat 3.0 - 3.4.25 QuestHelper - QuestHelper 4.3.229b RatingBuster - 1.6.5 SexyMap - v1.2.5 TellMeWhen - r357 Tidy Plates - 6.4.8.5 Tidy Plates: ClassicPlates - Tidy Plates: ClassicPlates 1.2 TomTomLite - v40300-0.1.3 XLoot - r375-release X-Perl UnitFrames - r607


> Posted by CurseForge user mamapapaxp | Imported from CurseForge issue #394 | Raw

comments.body:
I'm guessing that since you submitted this with the Curse Client, there is no chance that you will give a response, but just in case you do, you need to turn on Lua errors and post whatever pops up. This bug report is useless to me otherwise.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Replying to this post as i have exactly the same problem, i have many addons but this problem occurs even if i disable them all, the lua error i get is..

Message: ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:2163: attempt to index upvalue 'HELP' (a nil value) Time: 12/21/11 00:43:16 Count: 1 Stack: [C]: ? ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:2163: in function `Load' [string "*:OnMouseUp"]:5: in function <[string "*:OnMouseUp"]:1>

Locals:


> Posted by CurseForge user tomthumb112

Could you install BugSack and BugGrabber (both are needed, and can be found on Curse) and post all of the errors that pop up? I am betting that there are more errors occurring than just the one that you have posted here, and while I can take a guess at the cause, it would not be a very accurate one, for this is a most strange error indeed.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Unfortunately, I checked here after I fired up the Curse Client this morning.

I saw another update (r359) and crossed my fingers. :)

Accidentally or not, it appears to have resolved the issue so cannot grab the Lua report now :(

All's well that ends well. Thanks for taking the time to reply.


> Posted by CurseForge user mamapapaxp

Using BugGrabber and BugSack.....

6x AceLocale-3.0-6: TellMeWhen: Missing entry for "ANIM_MAGNITUDE_DESC" TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options-r357.lua:284: in function "TT" <string>:"*:OnLoad":2: in function <string>:"*:OnLoad":1 <in C code> TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen-r357.lua:2457: in function "LoadOptions" TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen-r357.lua:1533: in function "Update" TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen-r357.lua:4623: in function "LockToggle" TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen-r357.lua:4633: in function "?" Ace3-r1045\AceConsole-3.0\AceConsole-3.0-7.lua:94: in function "?" FrameXML\ChatFrame.lua:4293: in function <FrameXML\ChatFrame.lua:4239> <in C code> FrameXML\ChatFrame.lua:3992: in function <FrameXML\ChatFrame.lua:3991> <in C code> FrameXML\ChatFrame.lua:4031: in function "ChatEdit_OnEnterPressed" <string>:"*:OnEnterPressed":1: in function <string>:"*:OnEnterPressed":1

Locals: nil

Only addons i have enabled are Buggrabber, Bugsack, Tellmewhen, Tellmewhen options and Lib: Ace3 (which is forced on when i enable Tellmewhen)

It is worth noting that i am pretty sure Ace3 had a recent update, also today the tellmewhen options will now open when right clicking on the frame (yesterday would not) although i still get the lua error upon logging in regardless of right clicking on the frame or not.


> Posted by CurseForge user tomthumb112

Sorry, another post again :) This is highly strange but it appears right clicking the menu only works if buggrabber/bugsack is enabled, regardless of how many addons i have enabled (tried with both 0 except for tellmewhen and also with all addons enabled) the menu will not open unless Buggrabber is enabled also.


> Posted by CurseForge user tomthumb112

Missing entry errors were fixed in r359. I took a guess at what the original problem was, looks like I fixed it (kinda, I just moved it out from the main code which is what I should have done in the first place anyway).

Tom, that is really weird. Are there any errors that occur right when you click? And are you using r359 (http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/files/493-r359/)?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I was only getting an error when i reloaded ui or logged in, with buggrabber enabled , right clicking on the bars just opened the options (as long as buggrabber was enabled) as normal with no new error. I am glad to say though that i have since updated to r360 and all is working as intended with no errors at all. Thanks for the fix, whatever you did :)


> Posted by CurseForge user tomthumb112
